metadata.title: CVE-2023-52436 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: f2fs:explicitly null-terminate the xattr list When setting an xattr, explicitlynull-terminate the xattr list. This eliminates the fragile assumption thatthe unused xattr space is always zeroed.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-52436` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-102-generic - 5.15.0-102.112
linux-image-5.15.0-102-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-102.112
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-102-generic - 5.15.0-102.112
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-102-generic-64k - 5.15.0-102.112
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-27-generic - 6.5.0-27.28~22.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-27-generic - 6.5.0-27.28~22.04.1

No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.15.0-102.112').
